borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">1.&nbsp;The side and rear extensions, by reason of their excessive scale, inappropriate siting&nbsp;and incongruous design, represent unsympathetic&nbsp;additions which&nbsp;serve&nbsp;to close the 'gap' between the properties, resulting in a terracing effect and unbalancing the semi-detached buildings. The roof form appears disjointed, and the rear extension is contrived, which together result in undue harm to the character and appearance of the host property, streetscene and surrounding area.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to: </p><p style="">- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);</p><p style="">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</p><p style="">- Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p style="">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</p><p style="">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); and,</p><p style="">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenhamâ€™s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension, first floor side and rear extension and Conversion of garage including alterations to the front elevation to provide habitable accommodation.
